content.question: Which of the following best explains the decreased rate of inflation from 1998 to 2011 in Mexico?

choices.label: Neoliberal economic policies that removed barriers and restrictions on the economy led to a decreased inflation rate.
Economic barriers were put into place to discourage foreign investment, which resulted in a decreased inflation rate.
The decreased rate of inflation was a result of reforms promoted by social movements that put great pressure on the government.
Multinational corporations invested in southern Mexico and created jobs that led to a decreased inflation rate.

content.answer: Neoliberal economic policies that removed barriers and restrictions on the economy led to a decreased inflation rate.
